intro: Phyla nodiflora var. nodiflora, commonly known as beach morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that thrives in coastal and sandy environments. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped blue or violet flowers. It has a fibrous root system and is well-adapted to salt spray and sandy soils. This species is often used for dune stabilization due to its hardy nature and ability to prevent erosion.
